titleInfo.title: RUNAWAY committed to the Jail of Rapides Parish

mods.abstract: RUNAWAY committed to the Jail of Rapides Parish on 20th February, 1860, a certain negro man, dark mulatto, five feet 10 inches high, 28 or 30 years old, weighing about 150 pounds, one or two of his upper front teeth decayed. He gives his name as JOSHUA, and says he is the property of JOHN BROWN, recently residing on Bayou DeGlaise in Avoyelles, but now removed to the ""Plains"" across the Mississippi River about 25 miles from Baton Rouge. Says he left his master on 26th December last. The boy had when taken up a Carpet Bag, some very good clothes, and $35 in money. The owner is notified to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take him away otherwise he will be disposed of as the law directs. ISRAEL GOREE. Jailor. Feb 22-2m
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
